{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3126653,"name":"Fermin A. Gomez","username":"merfin04","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/6bbea6/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-15T05:24:13.639Z","cooked":"

Our team recently bought a new NavX 2 MXP from Studica:

studica.com

Studica - Innovative Technology Products for Education & Industry

Studica is a leading developer, manufacturer and distributor of robotics and technology products for education and industry.

but instead we received a NavX2 - Micro.
Is there any differences between them other than the size and form factor?
Should we try and get a replacement or should we keep it?
Thanks.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-15T05:27:52.656Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":483,"reads":260,"readers_count":259,"score":2472.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423226,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences","display_username":"Fermin A. Gomez","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.studica.com/nav2-mxp-robotics-navigation-sensor","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"NavX2-MXP Robotics Navigation Sensor | Kauai Labs | Studica","clicks":23}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55387,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6017 Mentor || FTAa"},"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences/423226/1","custom_user_title":"6017 Mentor || FTAa","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3126664,"name":"Joe","username":"hobojoe","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/51bf81/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-15T05:56:17.456Z","cooked":"

My team had the same problem last year. AFAIK capability wise it’s about the same except for one crucial difference: no SPI bus. You have to either link over USB or the i2c port. Both of which are much less reliable. I had so many issues getting it to work consistently last year that we just ended up falling back to our old navx 1st gen. Not worth the headache in my experience.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-15T05:56:17.456Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":244,"readers_count":243,"score":108.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423226,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences","display_username":"Joe","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56329,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences/423226/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3127523,"name":"James Taylor","username":"JamesT","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-16T18:13:46.295Z","cooked":"
merfin04:

but instead we received a NavX2 - Micro.

Can you DM me your order #? If ordered a NavX2 MXP, you should have received a NavX2 MXP, not a NavX2 Micro.

merfin04:

Is there any differences between them other than the size and form factor?

Besides size and form factor, it’s just the communication protocols, as hobojoe mentioned. While the NavX2 Micro will work for FRC, the NavX2 MXP is much preferred.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-01-16T18:13:46.295Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":204,"readers_count":203,"score":100.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423226,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences","display_username":"James Taylor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47161,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Studica R&D"},"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences/423226/3","custom_user_title":"Studica R&D","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186187,"name":"Technologyman00","username":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T13:33:56.817Z","cooked":"
JamesT:

Besides size and form factor, it’s just the communication protocols, as hobojoe mentioned. While the NavX2 Micro will work for FRC, the NavX2 MXP is much preferred.

Hi James could you explain why you think it is much preferred?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-04-11T13:33:56.817Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":143,"readers_count":142,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423226,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences","display_username":"Technologyman00","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7900, 1792, 1714"},"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences/423226/4","custom_user_title":"7900, 1792, 1714","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186195,"name":"","username":"cmwilson13","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmwilson13/{size}/3628_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T13:43:35.691Z","cooked":"

It has the highest throughput and lowest latency. also SIGNIFICANTLY more reliable in our experience and does not consume can bandwidth like the pigeon does but that’s a separate discussion.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-04-11T13:43:35.691Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":95.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423226,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":25951,"username":"Technologyman00","name":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10484,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences/423226/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186226,"name":"James Taylor","username":"JamesT","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T14:03:08.163Z","cooked":"

The MXP plugs directly into the roboRIO.

  • This gives a direct connection, whereas the micro has a fail point with a USB or i2c wire connection.
  • As long as the roboRIO is mounted to the robot, there is a good chance the MXP is also mounted to the robot. We have had a lot of cases this year of teams using the micro and not mounting it correctly to the robot. (IE. It was hanging loose)
  • SPI communication. The micro only offers UART and i2c.

Currently, the MXP uses an industrial-grade IMU, and the micro uses the non-industrial version of the IMU. We are in the process of modifying the boards, and in the future, with the redesign, only the industrial version will be used.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2023-04-11T14:03:08.163Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":27,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":199.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423226,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences","display_username":"James Taylor","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":25951,"username":"Technologyman00","name":"Technologyman00","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/technologyman00/{size}/178178_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47161,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Studica R&D"},"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences/423226/6","custom_user_title":"Studica R&D","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186246,"name":"","username":"cmwilson13","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cmwilson13/{size}/3628_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T14:16:53.125Z","cooked":"

one thing to note. the rio has a staged brownout protocol. it cuts power to the mxp port at a certain voltage. the rio never cuts usb power we use the mxp port for communication and a usb cable from rio to navx as a backup power supply in case of very brief brownouts on acceleration

@JamesT 10 months later followup: Does this still hold that the MICRO uses the non-industrial grade IMU and the MXP does? So if we care about performance/industrial-grade, not size, we should get the MXP? Thanks!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-02-15T20:12:56.426Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":32.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423226,"topic_slug":"navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences","display_username":"John Slagel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":47161,"username":"JamesT","name":"James Taylor","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ed8c4c/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56132,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/navx2-mxp-vs-navx-2-micro-differences/423226/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3310384,"name":"James Taylor","username":"JamesT","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-15T20:40:35.028Z","cooked":"

Newer Micros with USB-C ports have the industrial version. Ones that still use the mini port do not. The performance should be the same between the two. However, we have found that the industrial version is slightly better.
